wikipedia_page.main: Roy Robinson ((1931-01-26)26 January 1931 – 1999) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s. He played at club level for St Helens (Heritage № 730), Barrow and Warrington (Heritage № 604), as a second-row or loose forward, i.e. number 11 or 12, or 13, during the era of contested scrums.

response: Roy Lister Robinson, Baron Robinson, OBE (8 March 1883 – 5 September 1952), known as Sir Roy Robinson between 1931 and 1947, was a British forester and public servant.
*Roy Robinson bio, Australian Dictionary of Biography, ANU.edu.au

response: |align="left"  |. Known as "Digger". Sold to Barrow with Roy Robinson for a combined £2,260 fee
